basics.name: Nicole Nagatoshi
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Graduated at UH Manoa in Fall 2022. Majored in MIS and worked on a Minor in ICS.

courses: Disc. Math for Comp. Sci. I (ICS)

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa ICS Department
work.summary: Teaching students to be proficient in Microsoft Office programs, Photoshop/Gimp/SHH, Dreamweaver/HTML/CSS and, Python

A summer program/internship with X-Force, a program that gave students the opportunity to work with military employees as contract workers.  I was hired to make them an App and worked with a group to finish the app by the end of the program.

volunteer.summary: Learned to play music at a professional level
highlights: Time Management with school and making sure my skills were maintained at a high level

volunteer.summary: Lead section through sectionals and concerts

volunteer.organization: Roosevelt High School Grad with Honors
volunteer.summary: Needed at least 3.0 GPA, four years of science, math, English and history and, needed to pass at least two AP classes
highlights: Science: Biology, Chemistry, Marine Biology, Physics
English: English 1/2, AP English for two years
History: US History, World History, Hawaiian History, Sociology/Philosophy

volunteer.summary: Learned new music for each football game, played; at gigs, pep rallys, volleyball games, basketball games
highlights: Leadership, UHMRWM, 2017-2020, taught newcomers how to play instrument, held sectionals, made sure everyone was on time, made sure they were learning their positions on field, made music (seldom)

awards.title: Presenter at Media + Innovative Learning
awards.summary: After teaching ICS 101 in summer 2019, Dr. Michael Brian Ogawa and my co-workers started a research study and paper about the effects of using a 'memoji' instead of having no face camera. We wanted to know if having something talking to you while taking the online class was effective for the online learning environment. After we were able to present our findings at the Media + Innovative Learning Convention over zoom.
